title: Display font to pair with Whitney
content:
Hi folks,

I’m designing my resume, and have it all set in Whitney. It looks great, but a bit dry. I was hoping to set my name in a different font to add a little flavor, but can’t find a good pairing.

Anyone have a good suggestion for a display font to pair with Whitney? My initials are S.H. so anything with nice versions of those letters would work well.

Thanks!  
Sam

 [‹ Sans-Serif with Sloop Script Three](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122113443/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48612 "Go to previous forum topic") [Poster for client Pet Psychics Inc. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122113443/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48303 "Go to next forum topic")
author: samuel

comments.content: H&FJ have suggestions on [their website](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122113443/http:/typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100026). The Gotham SC with wide tracking they show as an example might look nice on a resume.

I’ve seen that, but thanks. I was hoping to get some ideas outside the Hoefler family.

Any ideas are welcome so toss them out there.
